meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Alright, let's get down to business. I've got my trusty controller in hand, my coffee is hot, and I'm ready to dive into the world of Lords of the Fallen. But before we start, let me just say that I'm not like other critics out there (ahem, IGN). I don't have a fancy degree or a reputation for being super serious. Nope, I'm just your average, run-of-the-mill seasonal grok video game reviewer with a sense of humor.

Now, onto the review!

Lords of the Fallen is an action-RPG that's got it all: dark atmosphere, challenging combat, and explorable areas that'll keep you busy for hours on end. But what really sets it apart from other Soulslike games is its unique twist - swapping between two versions of the world to solve puzzles and slay enemies. It's like having two games in one! And let me tell you, I was hooked.

Now, some critics out there might say that this game isn't perfect (ahem, SpazioGames). They might point out the technical issues and weak boss fights. But hey, who doesn't love a good challenge? And besides, those explorable areas? Wow! You'll be busy searching for secrets and taking in the sights.

And don't even get me started on the buildcrafting! It's like having your own mini-game within the game. I mean, what's not to love about crafting your own gear and building your character from scratch?

Now, some critics might say that this game is all flash and no substance (ahem, Worth Playing). But hey, who doesn't love a little flash every now and then? And besides, those action-packed combat sequences? They're the real deal.

All in all, Lords of the Fallen is an enjoyable game with a lot to offer. So if you're looking for a Soulslike game that's a little different, look no further! Just remember, it's not perfect - but who is, right?

Hippo out.
